alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Greensville; Lunenburg; Mecklenburg; Nottoway (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 8:16PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN GREENSVILLE... SOUTHEASTERN MECKLENBURG...SOUTHEASTERN LUNENBURG...SOUTHEASTERN NOTTOWAY...SOUTHWESTERN PRINCE GEORGE...CENTRAL SUSSEX...DINWIDDIE AND BRUNSWICK COUNTIES THROUGH 900 PM EDT... At 816 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Dinwiddie to Alberta to 7 miles northeast of Boydton. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Dinwiddie, South Hill, Waverly, Lawrenceville, McKenney, Brodnax, Purdy, Brunswick, Sussex, Jarratt, La Crosse, Alberta, Stony Creek, Dewitt, Dundas, Carson, Radium, Ebony, Gasburg, and Bacons Fork. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for south central and southeastern Virginia.
